result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Davis Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Davis Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Davis Jr was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 7 DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes:
*PAY ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND DNA SURCHARGES DURING PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT TO BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT.
*RESTITUTION SET AT ZERO.
*Court will GRANT motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Davis Jr
Current: 4019 W MARION ST, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 06-16-2015)
Prior: 6632 North 43rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Anthony Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded as to Count TWO: 

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 7 DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEAR
with the following conditions:

*PAY ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND DNA SURCHARGES DURING PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT TO BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT
*NO NEW VIOLATION OF THE LAW
*PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE
*RESTITUTION SET AT ZERO

Court will GRANT motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

As to Count Two: 
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

On motion of the State, Court ordered Count ONE:  Dismissed. 

 Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47

Defendant Anthony Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered bench  warrant withdrawn and bail reinstated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Anthony Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. DEFENDANT MISSED A JURY TRIAL DAY.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No file in court.   Defense motion to adjourn the jury trial is granted by the court.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47.   Court vacates the date of 4-20-16 at  8:30 .  Jury trial scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense filed witness list.
State filed motion in limine ;witness list and proposed jury instructions.
Defendant Anthony Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case remains on for jury trial.

Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 9-2-15 at 8:30 in branch 47. lr  Calendar call scheduled for 09-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defense attorney in trial in another court and requests an adjourned Status Conference. Case adjourned to 47.  Status conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tanisha J.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Davis in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/22/15 @ 1:30pm
